intro: Eleocharis reichei, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into dry, three-lobed fruits. Eleocharis reichei plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
